definition[0]: in spite of what you thought was true or expected to happen
example[0]: He wrote to say they couldn’t give me a job after all.
example[1]: Union leaders announced that they would, after all, take part in the national conference.
definition[1]: used to say that something should be remembered or considered, because it helps to explain what you have just said
example[2]: Prisoners should be treated with respect – they are human beings after all.
example[3]: I don’t know why you’re so concerned – it isn’t your problem after all.
